benchmark_details.name: MMTrail (A Multimodal Trailer Video Dataset with Language and Music Descriptions)
benchmark_details.overview: MMTrail is a large-scale multi-modality video-language dataset incorporating more than 20M trailer clips with visual captions and 2M high-quality clips with multimodal captions designed to enhance multimodal understanding and generation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To unlock the potential of multimodal content understanding and generation for innovative applications in video content generation.

data.source: Collection of over 20M trailer clips from various categories, processed to ensure high-quality annotations.
data.annotation: Annotations include auto-generated captions and manually adjusted multimodal captions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on predicted captions compared to ground truth using standard methods.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in BLEU, ROUGE, CIDEr, and BERT indicate better contextual and semantic similarity in captioning.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison against existing video-language datasets shows improved performance on various metrics.
methodology.validation: Various human evaluation metrics are used to validate the quality of the multimodal annotations.
